<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The aggregate market value of the Class A Common Stock held by non-affiliates as of January 31, 2016 (the last business day of the registrant&#8217;s most recently completed second fiscal quarter) was $28,872,825.&#160; This amount is based on the closing price of the registrant&#8217;s Class A Common Stock on the National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations (NASDAQ) Stock Market for that date.&#160; Shares of Class A Common Stock held by the executive officers and directors of the registrant are not included in this computation.

	As of September 30, 2016, 3,000,956 shares of the registrant's Class A Common Stock, $.01 par value (the "Class A Common Stock") were outstanding, and 1,293,146 shares of the registrant's Class B Common Stock, $.01 par value (the "Class B Common Stock") were outstanding.

</DIV>
</DIV>

	PART I
</DIV>
<DIV>

</DIV>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
<A NAME="FORM10K_HTM_ITEM1_">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	Item 1.
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	Business
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	References in this Annual Report on Form 10-K (the &#8220;Annual Report&#8221;) to &#8220;EEI&#8221; refer to Ecology and Environment, Inc., a New York corporation.&#160; References to &#8220;the Company,&#8221; &#8220;we,&#8221; &#8220;us,&#8221; &#8220;our,&#8221; or similar terms refer to EEI together with its consolidated subsidiaries.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Organization and Background
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	EEI was incorporated in February 1970 as a global broad-based environmental consulting firm with an underlying philosophy to provide professional services worldwide so that sustainable economic and human development may proceed with acceptable impact on the environment.&#160; Together with its subsidiaries, EEI has direct and indirect ownership in 7 active wholly-owned and majority-owned operating subsidiaries in 5 countries.&#160; Our staff is comprised of individuals representing numerous scientific, engineering, health, and social disciplines working together in multidisciplinary teams to provide innovative environmental solutions.&#160; Our consolidated group of companies have completed thousands of projects for a wide variety of clients including some of the most iconic, high-profile projects in the world.&#160; Our revenues originate from federal, state and local governments, domestic private clients, and private and governmental international clients.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_3"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Fiscal Year 2016 Operations Overview
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Consolidated net income attributable to EEI decreased to $0.9 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2016, a 74% reduction from the prior fiscal year.&#160; Selected financial information by business segment is summarized in the following table.
</DIV>
<DIV>

</DIV>

<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Dispositions of Subsidiaries
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During fiscal year 2014, EEI management initiated a long-term strategy to assess the operations of all subsidiaries with the goal of improving consolidated financial performance by selling, winding down or reorganizing unprofitable subsidiaries.&#160; During fiscal year 2016, EEI completed the following transactions or activities related to subsidiaries that experienced operating losses during prior fiscal years:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z6B4EA6668D8F4461892D75B2E1F76638" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 9PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	EEI consummated the sale of a majority owned subsidiary located in Kentucky.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z38C232C957E44E688775A2EB342AEDDD" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 9PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	EEI curtailed the operations of a wholly owned subsidiary located in Colorado, and combined its remaining operations into EEI&#8217;s corporate headquarters in Buffalo, New York.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="ZDF4F9747EFC34F61ACCA2F9009540B40" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 9PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Other foreign operations has historically included operations in the Middle East, northern Africa and Asia.&#160; During fiscal year 2014, due to growing operational risks, management decided to wind down existing operations and not to seek or accept any new work within these regions.&#160; During fiscal year 2016, management successfully terminated all remaining contracts and operations within these regions.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Lower net revenues were more than offset by lower operating expenses during fiscal year 2016 as a result of this activity.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	U.S. Operations
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Excluding disposition of subsidiaries noted above, net income attributable to EEI from U.S. operations decreased 34% during fiscal year 2016, as compared with the prior year.&#160; Global economic trends in oil, gas and commodity prices continued to have a negative impact on revenues from energy and mining sectors in the U.S.&#160; EEI also experienced a distinct shift of direct labor hours during fiscal year 2016 from commercial projects, for which selling rates are openly negotiated from project to project, to government projects, for which selling rates tend to be lower than commercial rates.&#160; In addition, competitive pricing pressure continues to have a negative impact on revenues for many of EEI&#8217;s market sectors.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	South American Operations
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We have significant majority-owned operating subsidiaries in Chile, Brazil and Peru, and a smaller subsidiary in Ecuador.&#160; Our Chilean operations experienced strong revenue and earnings growth during fiscal year 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Significant energy sector project work was completed in Peru late in fiscal year 2015 and early in fiscal year 2016, which was not replaced during fiscal year 2016.&#160; Revenues and net income from Peruvian operations decreased 59% and 98%, respectively, during fiscal year 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Brazilian revenues and earnings continue to be adversely affected by a broad economic downturn and political upheaval.&#160; Brazilian revenues decreased 42% during fiscal year 2016.&#160; Additionally, as a result of recurring losses during recent years and in fiscal year 2016, our Brazilian subsidiary recorded a $0.9 million valuation reserve related to deferred tax assets recorded in prior years and was unable to recognize any tax benefit from fiscal year 2016 operating losses.&#160; The net loss from Brazilian operations increased $1.4 million to a loss of $1.7 million for fiscal year 2016.&#160; EEI management continues to work closely with management in Brazil to&#160;implement a&#160;business development strategy that is responsive to current economic conditions&#160;while also reducing operating costs and improving operating efficiency.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Environmental Consulting Services Offered
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We offer consulting services to commercial and government clients in a variety of service sectors, which include the following:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Government START Contract
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We provide support services to the United States Environmental Protection Agency (the &#8220;EPA&#8221;) for response and site assessment activities related to the release and threat of release of oil, petroleum products, hazardous substances, weapons of mass destruction or pollutants or contaminants that pose an actual or potential threat to human health or welfare, or to the environment.&#160; To date, we have supported the EPA under more than 40 contracts with a total award value exceeding $1 billion.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	5
</FONT>
</DIV>

</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In July 2013, the EPA awarded us with renewal of a contract known as START IV to provide continuing support to EPA Region 10, which covers the four state territory of Alaska, Idaho, Washington and Oregon.&#160; This is a combination time and materials/cost plus contract with a
</FONT>
	base term of three years and two two-year option periods, for a total potential contract term of seven years.&#160; During fiscal year 2016, the EPA awarded the first of the option periods to EEI.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160; This contract contains termination provisions under which the EPA may, without penalty, terminate the contract during the contract term upon written notice to us.&#160; In the event of termination, we would be paid only termination costs in accordance with the contract.&#160; We have never had a contract terminated during the contract term by the EPA.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Government Task Order Contracts
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We have numerous task order contracts with state and federal governmental agencies which contain indefinite order quantities and/or option periods ranging from one to seven years.&#160; Services provided under these contracts include numerous environmental assessment projects with the U.S. Navy, engineering and oversight of pollution remediation, and other hazardous waste remediation activities for various state entities.&#160; We also prepare environmental impact assessment documents for federal land management agencies such as the Bureau of Land Management.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Energy
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	New technology and increasing demand for less carbon intensive and more sustainable use of resources presents complex challenges to energy developers and providers.&#160; To keep pace with growing energy needs worldwide, we provide services to all phases of energy development by conducting critical feature/fatal flaw analyses, social and health impact assessments, feasibility and siting studies, field surveys, permitting, construction inspection and compliance monitoring.&#160; As public participation has become increasingly important, EEI has developed specialized tools and techniques for successful stakeholder engagement.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z9ADB2316268D4D9E9FE25B0C3B603E80" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 9PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Electric Transmission
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Our comprehensive approach to transmission project siting and permitting has developed from experience on over 16,000 miles of transmission line, including underwater and underground DC lines, urban rebuilds, and renewable generation interconnections.&#160; We prepare feasibility studies, evaluate alternative routes, analyze environmental impacts, and acquire needed certificates, approvals, and permits for electric transmission facilities worldwide to bring renewable energy from its source to regional population centers as well as to upgrade aging infrastructure.&#160; Recognizing the increasing need for proactive public involvement, we work closely with our clients to effectively engage stakeholders and identify environmental constraints, community concerns, and permitting requirements early.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="ZCBDA28D317814FDCB3EE02D5535B09F3" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 9PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Pipelines
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	To date, we have worked on more than 250 projects in the pipeline industry involving more than 50,000 miles of pipeline systems.&#160; Our extensive experience includes route selection, evaluation of alternatives, field surveys, regulatory compliance and permit support, preparation of environmental monitoring and restoration plans, and environmental inspection, including development of quality assurance specifications.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z715549A97A754749B296CE78CA7F8150" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 9PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Offshore Energy
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Global demand for renewable energy has stimulated the development of new technologies for generating energy from ocean currents, tides, waves, and thermal resources.&#160; The rising demand for fossil fuels, particularly natural gas, has expanded the exploration and production of offshore oil and gas reserves and global trade of liquefied natural gas (&#8220;LNG&#8221;).
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The LNG industry in the United States has seen dramatic changes in the last few years. The rapid development of shale gas resources has advanced the U.S. from having to import natural gas to now producing natural gas in excess of domestic needs. This has transformed the U.S. LNG marketplace from one where LNG import terminals were being permitted and constructed to one where LNG export terminals are now being permitted and constructed. E &amp; E has worked with clients to develop offshore and onshore LNG import and export terminals and associated pipelines.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	6
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We have extensive experience conducting siting, environmental analyses, and permitting for offshore energy projects worldwide, including wind farms, wave energy converters, deep water ports, floating production storage and offloading facilities (&#8220;FPSOs&#8221;), and subsea pipeline and electrical transmission cables.&#160; We guide clients in developing successful permitting strategies and provide comprehensive environmental and regulatory support for offshore energy projects.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We prepare third-party Environmental Impact Statements (&#8220;EISs&#8221;) and Environmental Impact Assessments (&#8220;EIAs&#8221;), Deepwater Port Applications, and Federal Energy Regulation Commission (&#8220;FERC&#8221;) Environmental Reports (&#8220;ERs&#8221;).&#160; We also perform siting/feasibility studies, plankton surveys, marine mammal acoustic impact modeling, dredging impact studies, coastal zone consistency evaluations, risk assessments, and marine vessel traffic studies, and develop and implement comprehensive plans for stakeholder engagement/outreach.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="ZFBF60FD2E5EB4CAE91F556C4F3F7073B" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 9PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Wind Energy
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We have extensive experience providing strategic environmental consulting services to wind energy developers and are a consulting member of the American Wind Energy Association (&#8220;AWEA&#8221;).&#160; Our nationwide team has collectively worked on more than 450 wind energy projects in 38 states, helping clients successfully develop wind projects capable of producing more than 6,000 megawatts (&#8220;MWs&#8221;) of environmentally safe, renewable electricity.&#160; Our direct experience with wind energy development, from initial siting studies through construction and mitigation monitoring of completed wind energy projects, allows us to anticipate potential project delays and resolve issues to keep client projects on schedule.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We provide strategic consulting in all facets of environmental permitting and compliance, environmental evaluation, threatened and endangered species, avian and bat surveys, and land use studies.&#160; Our civil engineering support services include design of structure foundations and roadways and coordination for gathering line placement, substation, and transmission line requirements.&#160; In addition, we recognize that public outreach efforts are an important component of any wind power project and, therefore, maintain in-house public relations experts and graphic artists, who work as an integrated team to design outreach programs geared toward landowners and officials.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="ZEAC4E4700CE3473EBCF6329F24D818D5" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 9PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Solar Energy
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	We have assisted solar developers to permit and build projects powering more than 6,000 MWs of clean, renewable energy in 23 states.&#160; We have worked on more than 150 solar assignments, supporting all phases of solar energy development, including critical issues analyses, feasibility and siting studies, permitting and due diligence audits, environmental impact assessments, project permitting and construction monitoring and operational compliance.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Natural Resource Management and Restoration
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Our approach to restoration design focuses on mimicking natural systems in form, function, and process&#8212;developing practical strategies for sustainable design and uplift.&#160; We conceive and design environmental restoration projects that restore affected habitat through the efficient and innovative integration of biological and engineering solutions.&#160; We assist our clients in meeting their goals by applying restoration measures to mine reclamation, contaminated sediment remediation, land development strategies, recreational planning, comprehensive watershed planning, and threatened and endangered species protection.&#160; Current work also includes helping clients such as the US Army Corps of Engineers address invasive species such as hydrilla and algal blooms in the Great Lakes watershed.&#160; Through our work with The Nature Conservancy, we are also helping to restore areas on the Gulf Coast.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	7
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Sustainability, Resiliency, and Climate Adaptation
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	E &amp; E planning teams are working with communities around the world to develop and implement sustainable approaches for projects as varied as neighborhood-scale urban redevelopment, large-scale green city planning and design, and regional sustainability plans.&#160;&#160; We help organizations and government agencies to become more resilient by assisting them to plan for, respond to, and recover from extreme disruptive events that can result in a wide range of cascading emergencies, with emphasis on building more resilient communities.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For example, we led the preparation of five community reconstruction zone plans developed as part of the New York Rising Community Reconstruction Program to help communities recently affected by extreme weather events build more resilient communities to better withstand storms of the future. E &amp; E also worked with the Colorado Resiliency and Recovery Office to prepare the Colorado Resiliency Framework, the state&#8217;s first resiliency plan.&#160; The plan represents Colorado&#8217;s long-term investment and commitment to a more resilient future following recent natural disasters that have affected the state.&#160; The framework&#8217;s development included engaging thousands of local stakeholders, identifying and analyzing risks and vulnerabilities from hazards and changing conditions, and identifying action items for state implementation.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Water Resources
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Water supply, water quality and watershed management issues are becoming increasingly intertwined as communities face mounting difficulties securing future resources.&#160; Water resource planning and management projects present diverse challenges ranging from understanding complex hydrologic systems to highly charged political issues and solutions must address stakeholder concerns, water rights, permitting requirements, ecosystem sustainability, public health, water supply, water quality, and economic feasibility. EEI&#8217;s water resource management practice includes work in water resources engineering, water studies and planning, and environmental restoration.&#160; We have experience working in the world&#8217;s most important water systems, including the Florida Everglades, Louisiana Coastline, Sacramento-San Francisco Bay Delta, Great Lakes, Hudson River, Chesapeake Bay, Puget Sound, Amazon River Basin, Yangtze River Basin, and many others.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Planning
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z2817004217584CC2B22B7D4E54B2FE6B" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 9PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Environmental Planning and Assessment
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Environmental impact assessment is at the core of our business.&#160; Since EEI&#8217;s inception, this work has included numerous major EIS and ER projects, initial studies and EAs, and has mitigated negative declarations in accordance with the National Environmental Policy Act (&#8220;NEPA&#8221;) and various state requirements.&#160; We also prepare similar documents under state laws, such as the California Environmental Quality Act.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="ZB89FC131F99F42DDA35AC99B8AC0FFCA" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 9PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Military Master Planning and Land Use Compatibility Studies
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In response to the advances seen in military master planning under taken by the Department of Defense (&#8220;DOD&#8221;) over the past few years, we have developed a team of experienced professionals in the areas of real property master planning, military programming, geospatial data and systems support, database management, and water resources planning.&#160; Through our experience with modern military facility planning, we develop technologically advanced military master planning tools by leveraging the latest in Geographic Information System (&#8220;GIS&#8221;) and information technology.&#160; We assist DOD installations to incorporate renewable energy and reduce their environmental footprint while sustaining mission requirements and maintaining positive relationships with the surrounding communities.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	8
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Emergency Planning and Management
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Events around the world involving terrorism, bioterrorism, and natural disasters continue to raise concerns for public health and safety as well as environmental protection.&#160; We provide logistical support, emergency response/management services, and comprehensive planning to businesses and state, county, and municipal governments in all phases of incident management, including preparedness, mitigation, response, and recovery.&#160; In providing these multifaceted services, we determine local vulnerabilities and hazards and the in-place resources/assets to address those hazards in the context of applicable state and federal laws and regulations and community desires to become more resilient.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Hazardous and Radioactive Material Services
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We have conducted thousands of hazardous waste site evaluations throughout the United States, providing site investigation, engineering design, and operation and maintenance for a wide range of industrial and governmental clients.&#160; We inventory and collect sample materials on site and then evaluate waste management practices, potential off-site impacts, and liability concerns.&#160; We then design, implement, and monitor associated cleanup programs. Our field investigation services primarily involve the development of work plans, health and safety plans, and quality assurance/quality control plans to govern and conduct field investigations to define the nature and extent of contaminants at a site.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	After field investigation services have been completed and the necessary approvals obtained, our engineering specialists develop plans and specifications for remedial cleanup activities.&#160; This work includes development of methods and standard operating procedures to assess contamination problems; and to identify, develop, and design appropriate pollution-control schemes.&#160; Alternative cleanup strategies are evaluated and conceptual engineering approaches are formulated.&#160; We also supervise actual cleanup or remedial construction work performed by other contractors.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	International
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Since EEI&#8217;s incorporation in 1970, we have completed more than 50,000 environmental assignments in more than 120 countries worldwide.&#160; Many of the services provided for our global clients are similar to the services we provide in the U.S. and help our clients to meet local expectations and regulatory requirements.&#160; With an understanding of cultural, political, economic, operational, and legal factors that influence the solution to a given environmental problem, we aid international governments and lending institutions in their efforts to advance institutional systems for environmental management.&#160; We have completed assignments involving environmental assessment; management and financial planning; institutional strengthening and standards development; water supply and development; wastewater treatment; and solid waste project construction supervision.&#160; More recently, issues of public health, sustainability, and social and economic development have been added to that portfolio.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As modernizing economies continue to develop, demand for global environmental services has also grown.&#160; Most countries now have environmental laws to protect and regulate development of natural resources.&#160; Many countries are also investing in infrastructure-related projects like bridges, roads, hydroelectric dams, mines, water supply, power generation and transmission, communications networks, and ports, all of which present opportunities for us to provide environmental services. Our international offices are also providing services for the development of renewable energy.&#160; Frequent and dramatic natural disasters in recent years have spurred many governments around the world to address disaster response and prevention strategies and the impacts of climate change, such as sea-level rise and storm intensity and frequency. Through our U.S. and South American operations, we believe that we are well-positioned to benefit from these growth opportunities.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Regulatory Compliance
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The federal governments of the U.S. and other countries where we operate have enacted numerous environmental laws governing a wide range of topics. Similarly, most U.S. state legislatures have enacted laws to prevent and correct environmental problems.&#160; Our operations are also influenced by international laws, treaties, conventions, and regulations designed to protect the environment.&#160; These laws and regulations help to create the demand for the multidisciplinary consulting services we offer.&#160; The principal U.S. federal legislation that affects our business include:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	9
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Contract Backlog
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At any point in time, we have a backlog of uncompleted projects and outstanding indefinite task order contracts that are expected to provide future revenue over a period of 1 to 7 years.&#160; These projects include a substantial amount of work to be performed under contracts which contain termination provisions that may be exercised without penalty at any time by our clients upon written notice to us.&#160; The likelihood of obtaining the full value under these contracts cannot be determined at this time.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

	Business Development

	Our business development activities take place everywhere we work.&#160; Although we have a dedicated business development group that includes sales, marketing and communications professionals, the technical staff is also active in identifying opportunities and developing business relationships.&#160; Specific business development activities include:

	&#160;

	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

	Participating in professional organizations and often speaking at seminars and conferences to enhance our professional knowledge and relationships;
</DIV>
</TD>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Competition
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We are subject to competition with respect to each of the services that we provide.&#160; No entity currently dominates the environmental services industry and no one organization has the capability to serve the entire market.&#160; Some of our competitors are larger than us, have greater financial and other resources than we do, or may be more specialized in certain disciplines or locations.&#160; Others have special status as small businesses.&#160; We compete primarily on the basis of our reputation, quality of service, expertise, responsiveness and price.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Management Team and Employees
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Our management and staff is comprised of individuals with advanced degrees representing scientific and engineering disciplines working together in multidisciplinary teams to provide innovative solutions.&#160;
</FONT>
	The members of our executive management team have extensive experience in the environmental consulting industry.&#160; The professional backgrounds of our executive management team are described in Item 10 of this Annual Report.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As of July 31, 2016, including all of our subsidiaries, we had 893 employees (735 full-time) in all of our offices, which included 585 employees (435 full-time) in domestic offices and 308 employees (300 full-time) in foreign offices.&#160; The majority of our employees hold bachelor's and/or advanced degrees in such areas as chemical, civil, mechanical, sanitary, soil, structural and transportation engineering, biology, geology, hydrogeology, ecology, urban and regional planning and oceanography.&#160; The employees at our majority-owned subsidiary in Brazil (97 full time employees as of July 31, 2016) are represented by a labor organization.&#160; We believe that our relationship with the labor organization in Brazil and with all of our employees is good.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Corporate Governance and Security Exchange Rules
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Our shares of Class A Common Stock are listed on the National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations (NASDAQ) Stock Market.&#160; NASDAQ requires all of its listing companies to be in compliance with NASDAQ&#8217;s standards of corporate governance set forth in the NASDAQ Marketplace Rules (NASDAQ CG Rules).&#160; We have certified to the NASDAQ that we are in compliance with the NASDAQ CG Rules except for those NASDAQ CG Rules relating to the Director Nominations Process, the Compensation of Officers and Board Compensation.&#160;&#160; For these items, we relied upon the &#8220;controlled company&#8221; exception found in the NASDAQ CG Rules.&#160; A &#8220;controlled company&#8221; is a listing company where more than 50 percent of the voting power of the listing company is in the control of a group.&#160; As of July 31, 2016, a group that holds more than 50 percent of the voting power of our Common Stock, consisting of Messrs. Frank B. Silvestro, Ronald L. Frank, Gerald A. Strobel, Gerard A. Gallagher and Michael C. Gross and members of their families, does exist.&#160; Therefore, we are a &#8220;controlled company&#8221; for purposes of the NASDAQ CG Rules.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Board of Directors will consider nominees for Directors recommended by shareholders.&#160;&#160;Shareholders wishing to recommend a director candidate for consideration by the Board of Directors can do so by writing to the Secretary of Ecology and Environment, Inc., 368 Pleasant View Drive, Lancaster, New York, 14086.&#160; Nominations must be received not later than the close of business on the 120
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	th
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	day prior to the first anniversary of the previous year&#8217;s annual shareholders meeting and not earlier than the close of business on the 180
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	th
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	day prior to the first anniversary of the preceding year&#8217;s annual shareholders meeting.
</FONT>
	In no event shall any adjournment or postponement of an annual meeting or the announcement thereof commence a new time period for the giving of a shareholder&#8217;s notice as described above.&#160; Nominations must meet the requirements of Article II, Section 4.A.1. of the Company&#8217;s Re-stated By-Laws dated February 25, 2016 (refer to Exhibit 3.9 of this Form 10-K).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	11
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage12"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In evaluating candidates, the Board considers the entirety of each candidate&#8217;s credentials to ensure that the Board consists of individuals who collectively provide meaningful counsel to management.&#160; The Board does not maintain a specific diversity policy.&#160; It believes that diversity is an expansive attribute that includes differing points of view, professional experience and expertise, and education, as well as more traditional diversity concepts.&#160; The Board considers the candidates&#8217; character, integrity, experience, understanding of strategy and policy-setting, and reputation for working well with others.&#160; If candidates are recommended by our shareholders, then such candidates will be evaluated using the same criteria.&#160; With respect to nomination of continuing directors for re-election, the individual&#8217;s past contributions to the Board are also considered.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has adopted a code of ethics that applies to its principal executive officer, principal financial officer, principal accounting officer and controller, as well as all other employees and the directors of the Company.&#160; The code of ethics, which the Company calls its Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, was filed as an exhibit to the Company&#8217;s annual report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2004 and is posted on the Company's website at
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	www.ene.com
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; If the Company makes any substantive amendments to, or grants a waiver (including an implicit waiver) from, a provision of its code of ethics that applies to its principal executive officer, principal financial officer, principal accounting officer or controller, and that relates to any element of the code of ethics definition enumerated in Item 406(b) of Regulation S-K, the Company will disclose the nature of such amendment or waiver in a current report on Form 8-K.
</DIV>
</EFX_BUSINESS>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<EFX_RISK_FACTORS>
<A NAME="FIS_RISK_FACTORS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
<A NAME="FORM10K_HTM_ITEM1A_">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	Item 1A.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Risk Factors
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In addition to other information referenced in this report, we are subject to a number of specific risks, which are outlined below. If any of these events occur, our business, financial condition, profitability and the market price of our Class A Common Stock could be materially affected.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Changes in environmental laws and regulations could reduce demand for our services.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Most of our business is driven by laws and regulations related to the protection of the environment. Any relaxation or repeal of these laws, or changes in governmental policies regarding the funding or enforcement of these laws, would have an adverse impact on our revenues.&#160; Also, reduced spending by governments may increase competition within our industry which may directly affect future revenue and profits.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	As a government contractor, we are subject to a number of procurement laws and regulations, as well as government agency audits.&#160; Any violation of these laws could result in economic harm to our operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We must comply with federal, state, and foreign laws relating to the procurement and administration of government contracts.&#160; Such laws include the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), the Truth in Negotiations Act (TINA), the Cost Accounting Standards (CAS), and the Service Contract Act (SCA).&#160; These laws impact how we do business with government clients and can increase the cost of doing business.&#160; In addition, in recent years, government agencies have mandated that their primary contractors utilize a higher portion of small and disadvantaged businesses as subcontractors.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Government agencies such as EPA and the Defense Contract Audit Agency (DCAA), as well as numerous state agencies routinely audit government contractors and their performance under specific contracts to determine if a contractor&#8217;s cost structure is compliant with applicable laws and regulations.&#160; They may question the incurrence of certain costs based on the FAR and CAS and disallow those costs on their contracts.&#160; These audits may occur several years after payment for services has been received.&#160; Historically, we have been able to successfully defend against the disallowance of any significant costs.&#160; However, there is no assurance that future audits will not result in the material disallowances for costs incurred in the future.&#160; Such material disallowances could negatively affect revenue, profits and cash flow.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	12
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage13"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	We depend on municipal, state and federal government work for a significant portion of our revenues.&#160; Inability to win or renew government contracts during procurement cycles could significantly reduce our revenue and profits.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenues from all municipal, state and federal government contracts represented 36%, 27% and 24% of total revenues for fiscal years 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.&#160; Inability to win or renew government contracts could adversely affect our operations and significantly reduce our revenue and profits.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Government contracts are typically awarded through a highly regulated procurement process.&#160; Some government contracts are awarded to multiple competitors, causing increased competition and downward pricing pressure.&#160; If we cannot reduce or control costs associated with these contracts, we may not be able to bid competitively, or unexpected losses on these contracts may occur.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Our clients may be acquired by other entities, or may elect to sell their interest in ongoing projects to other entities.&#160; These transactions would subject us to increased risk of contract terminations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	If our clients sell their interest in ongoing projects or are acquired by other entities, we may not be able to control or influence decisions made by the acquiring company regarding the ongoing contractual relationships of our client, including decisions to terminate existing contracts or to award future contracts.&#160; Such decisions by acquiring companies to terminate existing contracts, or to exclude us when awarding future contracts, could have an adverse impact on our results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Economic uncertainty could affect our public and private sector work.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Poor global and domestic economic conditions could impact the availability of funding for certain private environmental projects.&#160; In addition, governmental budget cuts or delays in governmental spending could defer or halt work on public environmental programs.&#160; These economic uncertainties could adversely affect our operations and significantly reduce our profits.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	International operations are subject to a number of risks.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenues from international operations represented 22% and 30% of total revenues for fiscal years 2016 and 2015, respectively.&#160; International operations are subject to a number of risks, including:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z31533F2AA92D401992DFCB221267493C" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 9PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	greater counterparty risk, leading to longer collection cycles and potentially uncollectible accounts;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z5A738900A1F74323A121C5F50EB4C675" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 9PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	currency fluctuations;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

	logistical and communication challenges;

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

	civil disturbance, unrest or violence; and
</DIV>
</TD>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z6FA844BCE6D043D6BDA00515D2D52D0D" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 9PT">
</TD>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	difficulties in staffing international operations with appropriately credentialed and trained personnel.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Failure to manage these risks effectively may result in harm to our overall operations and significantly reduce our future revenues, earnings and available liquidity.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	We must be able to accurately estimate and control contract costs to prevent losses on contracts.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We have three basic types of contracts with our clients: time and materials, fixed price and cost-plus.&#160; The percentage of our revenues associated with these contract types are summarized in the following table.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	13
</FONT>
</DIV>

	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 4PX DOUBLE; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	100
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	%
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We must control direct contract costs in order to maintain positive profit margins.&#160; Under cost-plus contracts, which may be subject to various types of ceilings, we are reimbursed for allowable costs plus a negotiated profit.&#160; If costs exceed ceilings or are otherwise deemed unallowable under provisions of the contract or regulations, we may not be reimbursed for all of our costs.&#160; Under fixed price contracts, we are paid a fixed price regardless of the actual costs incurred. Consequently, a profit is realized on fixed price contracts only if we are able to control costs and avoid overruns.&#160; Under time and material contracts, we are paid for our direct labor hours at fixed rates plus reimbursement of allocable other direct costs.&#160; Profitability is dependent on a consistently high utilization of staff and our ability to control our overhead costs.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	The use of the percentage of completion method of accounting could result in a reduction or reversal of previously recorded revenues and profits.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	A portion of our revenues and profit margins are measured and recognized using the percentage of completion method of accounting which is discussed further in Note 3 of the Consolidated Financial Statements. The use of this method results in the recognition of revenues and profit margins ratably over the life of a contract. The effect of revisions to revenues and estimated costs is recorded when the amounts are known or can be reasonably estimated. Such revisions could occur in subsequent periods and their effects could be material. Although we have historically been able to make reasonably accurate estimates of work progress, the uncertainties inherent in the estimating process make it possible for actual costs to vary from estimates in a material amount, including reductions or reversals of previously recorded revenues and profits.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Subcontractor performance and pricing could expose us to loss of reputation and additional financial or performance obligations that could result in reduced profits or losses.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We often hire subcontractors for our projects.&#160; The success of these projects depends, in varying degrees, on the satisfactory performance of our subcontractors and our ability to successfully manage subcontractor costs and pass them through to our customers.&#160; If our subcontractors do not meet their obligations or we are unable to manage or pass through costs, we may be unable to profitably perform and deliver our contracted services.&#160; Under these circumstances, we may be required to make additional investments and expend additional resources to ensure the adequate performance and delivery of the contracted services.&#160; In addition, the inability of our subcontractors to adequately perform or our inability to manage subcontractor costs on certain projects could hurt our competitive reputation and ability to obtain future projects.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Failure to attract and retain key employees could impair our ability to provide quality service to clients.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We provide professional and technical services that depend on our ability to attract, retain and train our professional employees to conduct our business and perform our obligations to ensure success.&#160; It may be difficult to attract and retain qualified expertise within timeframes demanded by clients.&#160; Senior managements&#8217; experience is essential to the success of any company and our ability to retain such talent is crucial to our profitability.&#160; Further, the loss of key management personnel could adversely affect our ability to develop and pursue our business strategies.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Failure to complete a project timely or failure to meet a required performance standard on a project could cause us to incur a loss which may affect overall profitability.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Completion dates and performance standards may be important requirements to a client on a given project.&#160; If we are unable to complete a project within specified deadlines or fail to meet performance criteria set forth by a client, we may incur additional costs or the client may hold us responsible for costs they incur to rectify the problem.&#160; The uncertainty involved in the timing of certain projects could also negatively affect our staff utilization, causing a drop in efficiency and reduced profits.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	14
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage15"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Our services could expose us to significant liability not covered by insurance.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The services we provide expose us to significant risks of professional and other liabilities.&#160; Our contracts generally require us to maintain certain insurance coverages and to indemnify our clients for claims, damages or losses for personal injury or property damage relating to performance of our duties unless such injury or damage is the result of the client's negligence or willful acts.&#160; Currently, we are able to obtain insurance coverage to meet the requirements of our contracts, subject to certain pollution exclusions.&#160; Additionally, we have an errors and omissions insurance policy that covers our environmental consulting services, including legal liability for pollution conditions resulting therefrom.&#160; Where possible, we require that our clients cross-indemnify us for asserted claims.&#160; There can be no assurance, however, that any such cross-indemnification agreements, together with our general liability insurance and errors and omissions coverage, will be sufficient to protect us against any asserted claim.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We are unable to predict the total amount of all potential liabilities that could arise under contracts with our clients.&#160; While we believe that we hold an appropriate level of coverage, we acknowledge that insurance may be inadequate or unavailable in the future to protect us for such liabilities and risks.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Management's voting rights could block or discourage a change in control.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Three of EEI&#8217;s current directors, two of which are also executive officers, owned or controlled approximately 54% of the outstanding shares of Class B Common Stock as of September 30, 2016, which has one vote per share while the Class A Common Stock has one-tenth of a vote per share.&#160; In addition, since the Company qualifies for the NASDAQ &#8220;controlled company exception&#8221; (refer to the section entitled &#8220;Corporate Governance and Security Exchange Rules&#8221; included in Part I of this Annual Report), there exists a group of holders of Class B Common Stock, composed principally of certain of the Company&#8217;s current directors and executive officers and members of their families (the &#8220;CCE Group&#8221;), that controls greater than 50% of the votes that may be cast for any proposal at a shareholders meeting.&#160; This concentration of voting control by the CCE Group may effectively prevent any influence by the holders of Class A Common Stock over matters submitted to a vote by all shareholders.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company may receive change in control offers by third parties. Such change in control offers may be declined by the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors after taking into consideration its obligations to the Company and its shareholders under applicable law.&#160; Alternatively, such offers may be taken to a vote by shareholders, the results of which could be heavily influenced by members of the CCE Group, which could adversely affect the value of outstanding common stock.
</DIV>
</EFX_RISK_FACTORS>
<DIV>
	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We own our corporate headquarters (60,000 square feet) and an additional warehouse and office facility (35,000 square feet), both of which are located in Lancaster, New York, a suburb of Buffalo.&#160; The corporate headquarters building also serves as our Buffalo regional office.&#160; We also lease thirty-six (36) regional offices in the United States and eleven (11) offices in foreign locations.

<EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<A NAME="FIS_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
<A NAME="FORM10K_HTM_ITEM3_">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	Item 3.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</U>
<U>
	Legal Proceedings
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Legal Proceedings
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	From time to time, the Company is a named defendant in legal actions arising out of the normal course of business.&#160; The Company is not a party to any pending legal proceeding, the resolution of which the management believes will have a material adverse effect on the Company&#8217;s results of operations, financial condition or cash flows, or to any other pending legal proceedings other than ordinary, routine litigation incidental to its business.&#160; The Company maintains liability insurance against risks arising out of the normal course of business.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On February 4, 2011, the Chico Mendes Institute of Biodiversity Conservation of Brazil (the &#8220;Institute&#8221;) issued a Notice of Infraction to ecology and environment do brasil Ltda (&#8220;E&amp;E Brasil&#8221;), a majority-owned subsidiary of EEI.&#160; The Notice of Infraction concerned the taking and collecting wild animal specimens without authorization by the competent authority and imposed a fine of 520,000 Reais against E&amp;E Brazil.&#160; The Institute also filed Notices of Infraction against four employees of E&amp;E Brasil alleging the same claims and imposed fines against those individuals that, in the aggregate, were equal to the fine imposed against E&amp;E Brasil.&#160; No claim has been made against EEI.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	E&amp;E Brasil has filed court claims appealing the administrative decisions of the Institute for E &amp; E Brasil&#8217;s employees that: (a) deny the jurisdiction of the Institute; (b) state that the Notice of Infraction is constitutionally vague; and (c) affirmatively state that E&amp;E Brasil had obtained the necessary permits for the surveys and collections of specimens under applicable Brazilian regulations and that the protected conservation area is not clearly marked to show its boundaries.&#160; The claim of violations against one of the four employees was dismissed, the remaining three employees have fines assessed against them that are being appealed through the federal courts. Violations against E&amp;E Brasil are pending agency determination.&#160; As of July 31, 2016, the Company recorded a reserve of approximately $0.3 million in other accrued liabilities related to these claims.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Contract Termination Provisions
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Certain contracts contain termination provisions under which the customer may, without penalty, terminate the contracts upon written notice to the Company.&#160; In the event of termination, the Company would be paid only termination costs in accordance with the particular contract.&#160; Generally, termination costs include unpaid costs incurred to date, earned fees and any additional costs directly allocable to the termination.&#160; The Company did not experience early termination of any material contracts during fiscal years 2016 or 2015.
</DIV>
</EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 56%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: -7.2PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 16.2PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	First Quarter (August 1, 2015 - October 31, 2015)
</DIV>
</TD>

<DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Holders of Common Stock
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As of September 30, 2016, 3,000,956 shares of the Company's Class A Common Stock were outstanding and there were 296 holders of record of the Company's Class A Common Stock.&#160; We estimate that the Company has a significantly greater number of Class A Common Stock shareholders because a substantial number of the Company's shares are held in street name.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As of September 30, 2016, 1,293,146 shares of the Company's Class B Common Stock were outstanding and there were 52 holders of record of the Class B Common Stock.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Dividends
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Including the fiscal year ended July 31, 2016, the Company has declared semi-annual dividends for 30 consecutive years.&#160; The Company declared dividends totaling $0.44, $0.48 and $0.48 per common share during the fiscal years ended July 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's Certificate of Incorporation provides that any cash or property dividend paid on Class A Common Stock must be at least equal to the cash or property dividend paid on Class B Common Stock on a per share basis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The amount, if any, of future dividends remains within the discretion of the Company's Board of Directors and will depend upon the Company's future earnings, financial condition, liquidity requirements and other factors as determined by the Board of Directors.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
